data.text: @continu_um @sapp_erlot Just goes to show that even if they had proof of their idiocy on the table in front of them, they would just make up some story as to why even that is wrong rather than face the inescapable conclusions of what they now face.
@JeremyMcilvride There's certainly a bit of that going on
@continu_um Yeah our esteemed leader and comrade in arms won’t want to release us from the Gulag until just before the election. The feel good thing might win her votes🤦‍♂️

@JeremyMcilvride Sure. We can agree on the "it's over" part, at least as far as the actual pandemic goes. I'm not so sure "it's over" as far as restrictions and overreach. Let's keep our fingers crossed on that one.
@continu_um We can’t predict what we don’t know given it never when down that way, we just have to get on living. Covid is over now, that I totally agree. Time to get living again.
@JeremyMcilvride The data are there. But sure, each to their own. This will be dissected after the years of ass-covering have eventually subsided (assuming we still live in a democracy).
@continu_um @justinfront You are correct, we didn’t have a vaccine at the start. We could have not bothered with vaccine and just hoped for the best. We will never know.

@JeremyMcilvride @justinfront Vax wasn't available at the start. I'm suggesting we could have achieved herd immunity through natural infection with moderate disruption, and invested heavily in protecting the elderly and otherwise compromised. Population-wide vaxs are moot, because they don't stop transmission
@continu_um We have different views and that’s fine, we live in a democracy.
